node.title: 'It's about choice': The people at the heart of the NSW euthanasia law debate
node.alt: A woman with grey hair and glasses looks out the window smiling
node.description: As NSW politicians continue debating the proposed voluntary assisted dying bill, the people it affects remain in limbo.
node.content:
["As NSW politicians continue debating\u00a0the proposed voluntary assisted dying bill,\u00a0the people it will affect remain in limbo.", "Janet Cohen, who is terminally ill, says\u00a0the ongoing political wrangling is\u00a0enough to keep her awake at night.", "\"The more delays, the more my anxiety increases. It's a very anxious time anyway when you're diagnosed with a terminal illness,\" Ms Cohen says.", "Should the bill pass, it would be 2023 at the earliest that sufferers could access services.", "Last month, the bill was\u00a0delayed to next year\u00a0after a committee referral to the Upper House.", "Waiting is not something Ms Cohen wants to do, having been diagnosed with terminal lung cancer in 2015.", "She is already investigating her options to access assisted dying services elsewhere.", "One option is to fly to Switzerland\u00a0if her condition deteriorates beyond what her treatment can provide.", "She is also considering moving to a state where she can legally end her life. However, her wish is to die at home.", "", "
Ms Cohen wants her partner Glenn to remember the fun times.(Supplied: Janet Cohen)
", "Ms Cohen says\u00a0the passing of the bill would also mean her loved ones would not\u00a0have to watch her die a slow\u00a0and \u2014 what she says would be \u2014 a degrading death.", "\"A bad death affects so many people,\" she says.", "\"It's not just about me;\u00a0it's about the members of my family, it's about my friends watching my potentially drawn-out, painful, degrading deterioration.", "
'It's about wanting to have the choice'
", "Family is also front of mind for former school principal Belinda Ryan, who is battling\u00a0myeloma;\u00a0a type of aggressive blood cancer.", "She feels she has only\u00a0a small range of options.", "\"If things got too tough, do I want my family to watch this?\u00a0Do I want to put my family and my carers through this? How could I take my own life?\"", "Belinda says access to voluntary euthanasia would not be a precursor to\u00a0using it, but the option offers\u00a0reassurance if suffering were to become\u00a0too great.\u00a0", "\"I may not choose that. It's not about:\u00a0'I want it, I'm going to use it',\u00a0it's about wanting to have the choice.\"", "", "
Belinda Ryan with her husband Howard, and dog Molly.(ABC Mid North Coast: Luisa Rubbo)
", "
Is religion the only opposing voice? \u00a0
", "Gloria Atkinson, a practising Presbyterian and former palliative care nurse, opposes voluntary euthanasia.", "", "
Gloria Atkinson would like to see better end-of-life support.(ABC Mid North Coast: Luisa Rubbo)
", "In her almost 10 years as a palliative carer, Ms Atkinson says\u00a0her patients had overwhelmingly positive end-of-life experiences.", "\"I never saw anyone out of control;\u00a0not being able to be helped by medication, somebody just being there.\u00a0", "\"I have never seen somebody in agony or suffering.\u00a0I've seen families that were apart come together around the bed.\"", "Ms Atkinson has\u00a0moved to Port Macquarie to care for a friend with a terminal illness.", "She says\u00a0her support for her friend has helped carry the family's burden of grief.", "\"The family are grieving, and the family are upset about what's happening. There are\u00a0fears and worries around what's happening. A person walking alongside can see a bigger picture than the grieving family.\"", "While religion\u00a0influences her view, she says\u00a0it is not the sole factor.", "\"Once they see this person that's there,\u00a0who's offering to walk with them \u2013 then we're welcomed,\" Ms Atkinson said.", "\"They see the advantages, of somebody walking with them in this period of their life.\"", "
'Don't negate my choice'
", "Supporters of the bill say the\u00a0laws will not act as a replacement for palliative care.", "Ms Ryan says\u00a0she plans to access palliative care but would like to see another choice.", "\"It's literally about having another choice should palliative care options not be able to ease physical pain and allow people to pass in a dignified manner.\"", "As for undecided politicians, Ms Ryan says\u00a0personal ideals should not come into their thinking.", "\"No-one has to partake of these options should they not want to for whatever reason \u2014\u00a0personal, religious, whatever \u2014\u00a0but don't negate my choice.\"", "While the proposed laws may come\u00a0too late for Ms Cohen and Ms Ryan, they see them\u00a0as crucial for those who come after them.", "It is a choice Ms Cohen wants for all.", "\"What we should choose to do\u00a0is to have an empowered, peaceful, beautiful death;\u00a0and that's our right.\""]
